===Etymology===
The {{etyl|och|-}} words for "chopsticks" were {{zh-l|箸*}} (''zhù'', OC *''das'') and {{zh-l|梜*}} (''jiā'', OC *''keːb''). {{zh-l|箸*}} is preserved in Min dialects (Taiwanese ''tī'', ''tū''; Fuzhou ''dê̤ṳ''), {{etyl|ko|-}} {{ko-l|젓가락}} and {{cog|vi|đũa}}. Starting from the Ming Dynasty, the change to {{lang|zh|筷子}} occurred in Mandarin, Wu and some Cantonese dialects. The 15th century book ''Shuyuan Miscellanies'' ({{w2|zh|s:菽園雜記/卷01|《菽園雜記》}}) by {{w|Lu Rong}} ({{w2|zh|陸容}}) mentioned this change:
:{{zh-x|^如 舟行{háng} 諱「住」……，以「箸」為{wéi}「快兒{r}」|As the mariners feared {{zh-l|住*|to stay}} […], they called {{zh-l|箸*|chopsticks}} {{zh-l|快兒*}} (''lit.'' "quick").|CL}}

The bamboo radical ({{zh-l|竹*}}) was later added to {{zh-l|快*}} to form {{zh-l|筷*}}.
